snippet: Relatives of Americans killed by terrorist attacks in Israel filed suit against Arab Bank and the case has provoked a split in the Obama administration that pits the State Department against the Treasury and Justice Departments.
abstract: Multibillion-dollar lawsuit filed against Arab Bank by relatives of American citizens killed or injured by terrorist attacks in Israel has caused a significant split in the Obama administration; State Dept wants the administration to come to the bank's aid while Treasury and Justice Depts says it should stay out of the case; bank has now asked the Supreme Court to intervene, court has asked Obama administration whether it thinks it should hear case, and administration is at an impasse over what to tell the justices.
lead_paragraph: Relatives of Americans killed by terrorist attacks in Israel filed suit against Arab Bank and the case has provoked a split in the Obama administration that pits the State Department against the Treasury and Justice Departments.

headline.main: Terror Suit Against Jordanian Bank Tests U.S. Diplomacy and Secrecy Laws
headline.print_headline: Terror Suit Tests Diplomacy and Bank Secrecy Laws
